solution_line_template: The wide cupboard holds twice as many glasses as the tall cupboard, amounting to {tall_cupboard_capacity} * {twice_factor} = <<{tall_cupboard_capacity}*{twice_factor}={wide_cupboard_capacity}>>{wide_cupboard_capacity} glasses.

Each of the shelves in the narrow cupboard holds {narrow_cupboard_total_capacity} / {number_of_shelves} = <<{narrow_cupboard_total_capacity}/{number_of_shelves}={glasses_per_shelf}>>{glasses_per_shelf} glasses.

Since a shelf was broken, a narrow cupboard now holds only {narrow_cupboard_total_capacity} - {glasses_per_shelf} = <<{narrow_cupboard_total_capacity}-{glasses_per_shelf}={narrow_cupboard_actual_capacity}>>{narrow_cupboard_actual_capacity} glasses.
